overview: From 2026-01-18 to 2026-01-25, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (1 merged), 1 new issues, and 12 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Fix TOCTOU race condition in credit deduction for streaming endpoints
topIssues.author: linear
topIssues.body:
Implement "deduct-before, reconcile-after" pattern to fix TOCTOU (Time-Of-Check-To-Time-Of-Use) race condition in streaming API endpoints.

Clean unification (we already do a good TOCTOU in MCP!
```markdown BEFORE (Vulnerable - Race Condition) ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê Request 1 ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê Request 2 ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ CHECK balance ‚â• $0.02? ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ ‚úÖ YES ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê Request 3 ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ (all pass) ‚îÇ Request N ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚ñº ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ STREAMING (10+ sec) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ No lock held on balance ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚ñº All requests ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ DEDUCT $0.02 each ‚îÇ ‚ñº üí• Balance goes NEGATIVE or deductions FAIL silently AFTER (Fixed - Atomic Reservation) ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê Request 1 ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê Request 2 ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ ‚îÇ ATOMIC: SELECT FOR UPDATE + DEDUCT ‚îÇ Request 3 ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§ ‚îÇ (PostgreSQL row lock on org balance) ‚îÇ Request N ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚ñº ‚ñº ‚ñº Request 1 Request 2-N ‚úÖ RESERVED ‚ùå 402 REJECTED $0.03 (with buffer) "Insufficient credits" ‚îÇ ‚ñº ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ STREAMING (10+ sec) ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Credits already deducted ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚ñº ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ RECONCILE: actual cost = $0.012 ‚îÇ ‚îÇ REFUND: $0.03 - $0.012 = $0.018 ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚ñº ‚úÖ Balance NEVER negative ```

topIssues.title: SQL error 384-dim zero vector fallback
topIssues.author: Xayaan
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

USE_OPENAI_EMBEDDING setting isn't being respected, and the code is using a 384-dim zero vector fallback while the DB adapter is hardcoded to use the dim_1536 column.

Error      [PLUGIN:SQL] Failed to create entities (entityId=a2271fc6-fcbd-03f5-afa6-9e462c212936, error=Failed query: insert into "entities" ("id", "agent_id", "created_at", "names", "metadata") values ($1, $2, default, $3, $4) on conflict do nothing


**To Reproduce**


**Expected behavior**


**Screenshots**


**Additional context**

Full error : 

Error engaging with search terms: 36 |   async queryWithCache(queryString, params, query) {
37 |     if (this.cache === void 0 || is(this.cache, NoopCache) || this.queryMetadata === void 0) {
38 |       try {
39 |         return await query();
40 |       } catch (e) {
41 |         throw new DrizzleQueryError(queryString, params, e);
                   ^
error: Failed query: insert into "embeddings" ("id", "memory_id", "created_at", "dim_384", "dim_512", "dim_768", "dim_1024", "dim_1536", "dim_3072") values ($1, $2, default, default, default, default, default, $3, default)

topIssues.title: Dashboard bug

topPRs.title: [Draft] RLM provider prototype for Eliza Python core
topPRs.author: matomoniwano
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

N/A (exploratory / draft integration)

# Risks

Low

- Provider is opt-in and not registered by default
- No existing code paths are modified unless the RLM provider is explicitly used
- Fallback stub behavior when RLM dependency is not installed

# Background

## What does this PR do?


This PR introduces a **prototype RLM provider** for the Eliza Python core.

It adds:
- A minimal `RLMProvider` that follows the existing provider interface
- A thin `RLMClient` adapter that wraps an external Recursive Language Model (RLM)
- Safe stub behavior when the RLM dependency is not present

The goal is to explore whether RLM can be integrated cleanly as a reasoning backend,
without affecting Eliza‚Äôs memory, planning, or autonomy layers.

This is intentionally an early draft meant for discussion and iteration.

## What kind of change is this?

Features (non-breaking, opt-in)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

Idea originated from this tweet https://x.com/shawmakesmagic/status/2013151880810057772?s=20

This PR is an experiment to see if RLM can fit naturally into the existing
provider/model boundary without increasing coupling or complexity.

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

- `elizaos/providers/rlm_provider.py`
- `elizaos/providers/rlm_client.py`
- `elizaos/providers/README.md`
- `python/tests/test_rlm_provider.py`

## Detailed testing steps

- Instantiate `RLMProvider`
- Call `generate_text` with a prompt or messages
- Verify stub behavior when RLM is not installed
- Verify successful pass-through when RLM is available locally

No automated tests are included at this stage.

# Deploy Notes

n/a

## Discord username
Discord: matomo8925
X: https://x.com/momo_mattomo
Prj X: https://x.com/AgentRLM

topPRs.title: V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (test if context is going to blown)
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
Redo #6113 for 2.0.0, first pass --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a validation-aware, schema-driven prompt execution path and applies it across runtimes and message flows. > > - Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state`/`dynamicPromptExecFromState` (TS/Python/Rust) with per-field/checkpoint UUID validation codes, required-field checks, and retry with backoff; supports XML/JSON > - Refactors message handling (should-respond, single-shot, multi-step decision, final summary) to use structured schemas instead of ad-hoc parsing > - Implements streaming support in TS with `ValidationStreamExtractor`, `MarkableExtractor`, and streaming context helpers; emits rich `StreamEvent`s > - Introduces shared types: `SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent(Type)` in Python/Rust/TS type modules > - Adds XML parsing utilities (nested-safe) and normalizes structured responses; basic templating in Rust, Handlebars in TS > - Exposes validation level configuration (0‚Äì3) and model selection; defaults to large text models > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1e447bbc005cbad715eb819aba27eb35b54aa5b8. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot). ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added dynamic prompt execution with state injection and schema-driven validation. * Enabled validation-aware streaming with configurable validation levels (0-3). * Introduced built-in retry logic with exponential backoff for improved resilience. * Support for structured output validation across JSON and XML formats. * Per-field and checkpoint-level validation for enhanced data integrity. ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Summary

Introduces `dynamicPromptExecFromState()` across Python, Rust, and TypeScript runtimes to provide schema-driven prompt execution with context validation via UUID codes. The implementation detects when LLMs truncate output due to limited context windows by injecting validation codes at strategic positions (start/middle/end or per-field). Supports four validation levels (0=trusted to 3=full), exponential backoff retries, and optional validation-aware streaming via `ValidationStreamExtractor`. **Key changes:** - Cross-language API consistency for dynamic prompt execution with state injection - Validation code system to detect context overflow (4 levels: trusted, progressive, checkpoint, full) - Streaming integration with progressive validation and retry support - Schema-based structured output parsing (XML/JSON) with required field validation - Performance metrics tracking per model+schema combination (TypeScript only) - Comprehensive type definitions (`SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent`) **Critical issues in Python implementation:** - Callable prompt invocation wraps state incorrectly (`{"state": state}` vs direct state access) - Template substitution assumes `state.values` has dynamic attributes accessible via `dir()`, incompatible with protobuf State - XML parsing regex `\w+` won't match validation field names with underscores like `code_text_start` **Minor issues:** - Rust template rendering uses basic string replacement instead of full Handlebars compiler - TypeScript `_smartRetryContext` deletion during retry loop prevents reuse on subsequent attempts - ValidationStreamExtractor abort handling may leave inconsistent state

Confidence Score: 3/5

- Python implementation has runtime errors that will break production usage; TypeScript and Rust implementations are safer but need testing - Score reflects critical logical errors in Python (3 bugs that will cause runtime failures), plus architecture differences across languages. TypeScript implementation is most complete with metrics and full Handlebars support. Python bugs must be fixed before merge to avoid breaking callers. - `packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py` requires immediate fixes for callable invocation, state.values access pattern, and XML regex. Test the Python implementation thoroughly before merging.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py | Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation codes and retry logic; has critical bugs in callable invocation, state.values access, and XML parsing regex | | packages/rust/src/runtime.rs | Implements `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation and retry; template rendering is basic string replacement vs full Handlebars | | packages/typescript/src/runtime.ts | Implements `dynamicPromptExecFromState` with metrics, streaming, and validation; minor issue with `_smartRetryContext` deletion timing | | packages/typescript/src/utils/streaming.ts | Implements validation-aware streaming with multiple extractor types; minor state inconsistency on abort signal |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Runtime participant ValidationExtractor participant LLM participant Parser Client->>Runtime: dynamicPromptExecFromState(state, schema, options) Note over Runtime: Generate validation codes
(UUID snippets) Runtime->>Runtime: Build extended schema
with validation fields Runtime->>Runtime: Inject codes into prompt
(initial, middle, end) Runtime->>Runtime: Compile template with
Handlebars/state values alt Streaming enabled Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: Create extractor
(level, schema, codes) end loop Retry attempts (0 to maxRetries) Runtime->>LLM: Generate text with prompt alt Streaming loop Stream chunks LLM-->>ValidationExtractor: chunk ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Extract field content ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Check per-field codes
(level 0-1) ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Stream validated content end else Non-streaming LLM-->>Runtime: Complete response end Runtime->>Runtime: Clean response
(remove tags) Runtime->>Parser: Parse XML/JSON response Parser-->>Runtime: Parsed fields object Runtime->>Runtime: Normalize structured response alt Validation level 0-1 loop For each field with code Runtime->>Runtime: Check start/end codes match end else Validation level 2-3 Runtime->>Runtime: Check checkpoint codes
(one_initial, one_middle, etc) end Runtime->>Runtime: Validate required fields
are present and non-empty alt All validations pass alt Streaming (level 2-3) Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: flush() ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Buffered content end Runtime->>Runtime: Remove validation code fields Runtime->>Runtime: Update success metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return parsed response else Validation fails alt Has retries remaining Runtime->>Runtime: Calculate backoff delay Runtime->>Runtime: Wait for backoff Note over Runtime: Loop continues with retry else No retries left Runtime->>Runtime: Update failure metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return null end end end ```

topPRs.title: feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks

Low, new feature, uses some memory but I put configurable limit on it

# Background

## What does this PR do?

It add a dynamic prompt execution system

## What kind of change is this?

Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

People may use models with lower context and get hallucination, this helps detect when the context is blown out.

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes require a change to the project documentation.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a schema-based dynamic prompt executor with validation/retries/metrics and replaces ad-hoc prompting in message flows, plus supporting types/utils and test updates.
> 
> - **Core Runtime**:
>   - Add `runtime.dynamicPromptExecFromState(...)` for schema-driven prompt execution (XML/JSON parsing, UUID validation codes, retries, Handlebars state injection, token estimations).
>   - Track execution metrics via `modelSchemaMetrics` and `modelMetrics` with optional LRU eviction (`DYNAMIC_PROMPT_MAX_ENTRIES`) and retry policy (`VALIDATION_LEVEL`).
>   - Expose metrics getters/clearers; helper methods for cache/keys; minor logging adjustments.
> - **Message Service**:
>   - Replace manual `useModel` + XML parsing with `dynamicPromptExecFromState` in:
>     - `shouldRespond` evaluation (small model).
>     - Single-shot handler (requires `thought`, `actions`).
>     - Multi-step decision loop and final summary.
>   - Improve error logging and minor flow tweaks.
> - **Types/Utils**:
>   - Export `SchemaRow` and `State` from `types`; extend `IAgentRuntime` with `dynamicPromptExecFromState`.
>   - Export `upgradeDoubleToTriple` and `composeRandomUser` from `utils`.
> - **Tests/Test Utils**:
>   - Update `message-service` tests to mock `dynamicPromptExecFromState` responses.
>   - Add mock implementation in test runtime; minor logger formatting changes.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5905b5f9ab86dd7b7d727d92060575f42a8fc707. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: fix: send action callbacks to user in multi-step mode
topPRs.author: YuriNachos
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Fixes issue where action callbacks were not being sent to users in multi-step mode - Changes empty callback to actually call user's callback with action response - Ensures action responses (with attachments, etc.) are properly delivered ## Problem In multi-step mode, the callback passed to `processActions` was an empty function that just returned `[]`. This meant when action handlers called `callback()` with their response (e.g., generated images with attachments), it was never sent to the user. Users would only see "Provider executed: ATTACHMENTS" instead of their actual action response. ## Solution Modified the callback in multi-step mode to: 1. Mark when action callback is called with actual content 2. Call the user's callback with the action's response content ## Changes - `packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts`: Updated action callback in multi-step mode to properly forward action responses to the user Fixes #4947 --- ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Summary

This PR fixes a critical bug in multi-step mode where action callbacks were not being sent to users. The PR also adds an `unregisterAction` method to the runtime and fixes an entity connection issue in the reflection evaluator. **Main Changes:** - **Action Callback Fix**: Modified the callback in `default-message-service.ts` multi-step mode to properly forward action responses to the user's callback instead of returning an empty array. This ensures action handlers that call `callback()` with responses (e.g., generated images with attachments) are properly delivered to users. - **Unregister Action**: Added `unregisterAction()` method to `AgentRuntime` class and `IAgentRuntime` interface, allowing dynamic removal of actions with comprehensive test coverage. - **Reflection Evaluator Fix**: Added entity connection check in reflection evaluator before saving facts to prevent foreign key constraint violations when the agent entity hasn't been registered in the room yet. The changes are well-tested with new test cases added for both the `unregisterAction` method and the reflection evaluator entity connection handling.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The changes are straightforward bug fixes with clear intent. The action callback fix properly implements the expected behavior, the unregisterAction method is simple and well-tested, and the reflection evaluator fix adds proper defensive checks. All changes include appropriate test coverage and follow existing code patterns. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts | Fixed action callback in multi-step mode to properly forward action responses to users instead of returning empty arrays | | packages/core/src/runtime.ts | Added `unregisterAction` method to allow dynamic removal of actions from runtime | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/evaluators/reflection.ts | Added entity connection check before saving facts to prevent foreign key constraint violations |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant MessageService participant Runtime participant ActionHandler participant UserCallback User->>MessageService: Send message MessageService->>MessageService: handleMultiStepMode() MessageService->>Runtime: processActions(message, callback) Note over MessageService,Runtime: Before fix: callback = async () => []
After fix: callback forwards to user's callback Runtime->>ActionHandler: action.handler(runtime, message, state, callback) ActionHandler->>ActionHandler: Execute action logic
(e.g., generate image) ActionHandler->>Runtime: callback(content)
{text: "...", attachments: [...]} Runtime->>MessageService: Forward callback response alt After Fix MessageService->>UserCallback: callback(content) UserCallback->>User: Send response with attachments else Before Fix MessageService->>User: Return empty array []
User sees "ATTACHMENTS" instead end ```

topPRs.title: feat: add unregisterAction method to core runtime
topPRs.author: YuriNachos
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Adds ability to unregister actions from the runtime - Implements `unregisterAction` method using array mutation (splice) - Adds comprehensive test coverage for unregister functionality ## Problem There was no way to remove actions from the runtime once they were registered. This made it impossible to dynamically manage actions during runtime. ## Solution Added `unregisterAction(actionName: string): boolean` method to: - `IAgentRuntime` interface in `packages/core/src/types/runtime.ts` - Runtime implementation in `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` - Test coverage in `packages/core/src/__tests__/runtime.test.ts` The implementation uses `splice()` to modify the readonly array in-place, avoiding TypeScript errors while maintaining readonly semantics for external consumers. ## Changes - `packages/core/src/types/runtime.ts`: Added `unregisterAction` method signature - `packages/core/src/runtime.ts`: Implemented `unregisterAction` using array mutation - `packages/core/src/__tests__/runtime.test.ts`: Added 3 test cases Fixes #5697 --- ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the ability to dynamically unregister actions from the runtime, addressing issue #5697. The implementation includes a new `unregisterAction` method that removes actions by name and returns a boolean indicating success. The PR also includes an unrelated but beneficial fix to the reflection evaluator that ensures entity connections exist before saving facts, preventing potential database constraint violations. **Key Changes:** - Added `unregisterAction(actionName: string): boolean` to the `IAgentRuntime` interface - Implemented the method in `AgentRuntime` using `Array.splice()` with proper logging (debug on success, warn on not found) - Added 3 comprehensive test cases covering successful unregistration, non-existent action handling, and selective removal - Enhanced reflection evaluator to call `ensureConnection` before saving facts, with proper error handling - Added test coverage for the reflection evaluator entity connection logic - Changed null check from `!=` to `!==` for stricter equality (minor code quality improvement) **Implementation Quality:** The `unregisterAction` implementation follows the project's patterns with appropriate logging and clean boolean return semantics. The use of `splice()` on the readonly array is acceptable as it maintains external immutability while allowing internal mutation. The test coverage is thorough and follows existing test patterns using `bun:test`. **Reflection Evaluator Enhancement:** The plugin-bootstrap changes are marked as part of this PR but appear to be a separate logical fix (ensuring entity connections before fact persistence). This is a positive addition that prevents runtime errors, though it could have been a separate PR for clearer change tracking.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The implementation is straightforward, well-tested, and follows existing patterns in the codebase. The `unregisterAction` method uses standard array manipulation with proper error handling and logging. All 3 test cases pass and cover the main scenarios. The reflection evaluator enhancement is a defensive improvement that prevents potential database errors. No breaking changes or security concerns identified. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/core/src/types/runtime.ts | Added `unregisterAction` method signature to `IAgentRuntime` interface, consistent with existing patterns | | packages/core/src/runtime.ts | Implemented `unregisterAction` method with proper logging and boolean return value indicating success/failure | | packages/core/src/__tests__/runtime.test.ts | Added comprehensive test coverage for unregister functionality with 3 test cases covering happy path, error case, and selective removal | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/evaluators/reflection.ts | Enhanced reflection evaluator to ensure entity connections before saving facts, preventing database constraint violations | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/__tests__/reflection-entity-connection.test.ts | Added test coverage for reflection evaluator entity connection logic |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Runtime participant Actions Array participant Logger Note over Client,Logger: unregisterAction Flow Client->>Runtime: unregisterAction("actionName") Runtime->>Actions Array: findIndex(a => a.name === "actionName") alt Action Found (index !== -1) Actions Array-->>Runtime: return valid index Runtime->>Actions Array: splice(index, 1) Actions Array-->>Runtime: action removed Runtime->>Logger: debug("Action unregistered") Runtime-->>Client: return true else Action Not Found (index === -1) Actions Array-->>Runtime: return -1 Runtime->>Logger: warn("Action not found, cannot unregister") Runtime-->>Client: return false end Note over Client,Logger: Reflection Evaluator Enhancement participant Evaluator participant State participant RoomDB Evaluator->>Runtime: Extract facts from AI response Evaluator->>State: Get room from state?.data?.room alt Room not in state Evaluator->>RoomDB: getRoom(roomId) RoomDB-->>Evaluator: return room with worldId end alt Room or worldId missing Evaluator->>Logger: warn("Room or world ID not found") Evaluator-->>Evaluator: return early (skip fact save) else Room and worldId exist Evaluator->>Runtime: ensureConnection({entityId, roomId, worldId, ...}) alt Connection Success Runtime-->>Evaluator: connection ensured Evaluator->>Logger: debug("Entity connection ensured") Evaluator->>Runtime: createMemory(fact) Runtime-->>Evaluator: fact saved else Connection Failure Runtime-->>Evaluator: throw error Evaluator->>Logger: error("Failed to ensure entity connection") Evaluator-->>Evaluator: return early (skip fact save) end end ```
